page.title: 01THE PARISHES - BOXGROVE
page.content:
{THE PARISHES}of Boxgrove, Tangmere and Westhampnett are positioned between the South Downs and The Channel in the Coastal Plain of West Sussex. The area is very flat, sloping gently from about 30 metres in the North to 10 metres above sea level in the South. The land is covered by a chalky flint called Valley Gravel formed during the Ice Age. Chichester adjoins the parish of Westhampnett to the West. Arundel is about 9 miles to the East, and Bognor Regis is about 4 miles to the South. The main South Coast road, the A27 from Southampton to Brighton, runs through the middle of the 3 parishes.
{BOXGROVE.}The present population of this parish is about 680, of which about 560 live in Boxgrove village. The numbers have decreased a great deal since 1950 when the population
